reviews.text:
It‚Äôs been a very long time since I‚Äôve been to Tony ps! One of the best Italian restaurants in Denver!

I love all of their food. Tonight I had spaghetti with Italian sausages, stuffed cap mushrooms, homemade lemonade and the walnut pear salad! No complaints. I left full and the waiting staff was great! Thanks Trinity! Hopefully I got your name right. Also the gentleman who was friendly and seated me when I walked in. Thanks for the brief conversation! üòä

Small but quaint little restaurant in the neighborhood. We were served quickly upon being seated maybe within 10 minutes. I ordered spaghetti and meatballs and a small pizza My wife ordered the Caesar salad. Pizza is on point! They have beer on tap and bottle beer along with a full wet bar. Happy hour between 2:00 and 6: 00. Service  was quick and very friendly to get us going on to our Broncos game üß°üíô

We stopped for lunch at Tony P‚Äôs yesterday and had a wonderful experience. We‚Äôre visiting from Utah for spring break, and I haven‚Äôt been in Denver for 25 years, so this was a bucket list stop. I worked for Tony from 1995-1997 while I was going to culinary school. In those days he had an amazing bakery called Campana and the best Italian restaurant on Broadway. I was lucky, and got to work at both! People would wait for hours, even when it was freezing outside. Tony Pasquini knows how to pull a crowd. I loved the people I worked with, the atmosphere, and I especially loved the food. Tony‚Äôs artisan breads will always hold a place in my heart. They took me all over the city because I sampled them for the bakery at Alfalfa‚Äôs and Wild Oats. I sold a lot of bread. ‚ô•Ô∏è
My memories of the pizza, breadsticks, marinara, and salads were spot on. The sauce, made with San Marzano tomatoes, is outstanding. I enjoyed every bite. We missed Tony but had the pleasure of meeting and being served by the manager. He took good care of us, answered all of my questions, and was kind when the nostalgia of everything brought some tears to my eyes. I couldn‚Äôt help it!
Tony, I think fondly of how well we were taken care of under your leadership. You and Judy made us feel like we were part of your family. Best wishes to you and Judy. I‚Äôm a forever fan and I‚Äôm so grateful I could share this experience with my family.
If you made it this far, take my advice and enjoy a meal at Tony P‚Äôs. I highly recommend regular visits! ‚ô•Ô∏è

A quaint place for lunch. Easy going prices on food: shared a medium pizza with apps and breadsticks with 4. Bill, our server was polite, calm cool and collected while bringing laughs to our party. The food was light and flavorful and the stuffed mushroom were a different, yet welcomed take.
We'll  be back soon for a second glance at the menu and to dive into new flavors.

I love Tony P's! Everybody working here is really nice, and it's my favorite neapolitan pizza I've had. The NY style pizza is really good, too. The espresso martini is great and so is the limoncello martini.

issues: Mobile performance data unavailable - API configuration required
recommendations: Configure Google PageSpeed Insights API for mobile analysis
Test website on mobile devices manually

recentReviews.author: Phil
recentReviews.text:
It‚Äôs been a very long time since I‚Äôve been to Tony ps! One of the best Italian restaurants in Denver!

I love all of their food. Tonight I had spaghetti with Italian sausages, stuffed cap mushrooms, homemade lemonade and the walnut pear salad! No complaints. I left full and the waiting staff was great! Thanks Trinity! Hopefully I got your name right. Also the gentleman who was friendly and seated me when I walked in. Thanks for the brief conversation! üòä

recentReviews.author: Bart Artz
recentReviews.text: Small but quaint little restaurant in the neighborhood. We were served quickly upon being seated maybe within 10 minutes. I ordered spaghetti and meatballs and a small pizza My wife ordered the Caesar salad. Pizza is on point! They have beer on tap and bottle beer along with a full wet bar. Happy hour between 2:00 and 6: 00. Service  was quick and very friendly to get us going on to our Broncos game üß°üíô

recentReviews.author: Samuel Edmondson
recentReviews.text: I love Tony P's! Everybody working here is really nice, and it's my favorite neapolitan pizza I've had. The NY style pizza is really good, too. The espresso martini is great and so is the limoncello martini.

recentReviews.author: patrick westlund
recentReviews.text:
A quaint place for lunch. Easy going prices on food: shared a medium pizza with apps and breadsticks with 4. Bill, our server was polite, calm cool and collected while bringing laughs to our party. The food was light and flavorful and the stuffed mushroom were a different, yet welcomed take.
We'll  be back soon for a second glance at the menu and to dive into new flavors.

recentReviews.author: Adrienne Yancey
recentReviews.text:
We stopped for lunch at Tony P‚Äôs yesterday and had a wonderful experience. We‚Äôre visiting from Utah for spring break, and I haven‚Äôt been in Denver for 25 years, so this was a bucket list stop. I worked for Tony from 1995-1997 while I was going to culinary school. In those days he had an amazing bakery called Campana and the best Italian restaurant on Broadway. I was lucky, and got to work at both! People would wait for hours, even when it was freezing outside. Tony Pasquini knows how to pull a crowd. I loved the people I worked with, the atmosphere, and I especially loved the food. Tony‚Äôs artisan breads will always hold a place in my heart. They took me all over the city because I sampled them for the bakery at Alfalfa‚Äôs and Wild Oats. I sold a lot of bread. ‚ô•Ô∏è
My memories of the pizza, breadsticks, marinara, and salads were spot on. The sauce, made with San Marzano tomatoes, is outstanding. I enjoyed every bite. We missed Tony but had the pleasure of meeting and being served by the manager. He took good care of us, answered all of my questions, and was kind when the nostalgia of everything brought some tears to my eyes. I couldn‚Äôt help it!
Tony, I think fondly of how well we were taken care of under your leadership. You and Judy made us feel like we were part of your family. Best wishes to you and Judy. I‚Äôm a forever fan and I‚Äôm so grateful I could share this experience with my family.
If you made it this far, take my advice and enjoy a meal at Tony P‚Äôs. I highly recommend regular visits! ‚ô•Ô∏è

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers are genuinely thrilled with their experience. With an average 5.0/5 rating across 5 recent reviews, your restaurant consistently exceeds expectations.

strengthsPerceived: Customers appreciate the friendly and attentive service, with staff members like Trinity and Bill making dining experiences memorable and enjoyable. - review management can highlight this positive aspect

The restaurant's ambiance and nostalgic atmosphere create a welcoming environment that makes guests feel like family, as noted by former employees and long-time patrons. - social media marketing can showcase this strength

Tony P's offers a diverse and flavorful menu, including standout items like Neapolitan and NY style pizzas, artisan breads, and unique dishes like stuffed mushrooms. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility

recommendations.title: Generate More Reviews
recommendations.description: Encourage satisfied customers to leave reviews
